name: Sheraton Lake Buena Vista Resort

reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights for a conferene at nearby WDW. I arrived too early and my room wasn't ready. Liz at the front desk escorted me to the doing room for breakfast. Brenda and Dennis in the dining room were very warm and attentive, remembered my preferences (e.g., skim milk for coffee) throughout my stay. Denise at the pantry also made sure I got what I wanted when they were out of them. Kudos all around to the staff.
reviews.title: Staff makes all the difference

reviews.text: The only negative are the parents who can't control their kids. I was jolted out of bed on two nights because kids were running up and down the corridor at 1 am! Called the front desk and security promptly took care of it. Also another kid pulled the fire alarm one afternoon and they had to evacuate the building. Parents please please please take control over the fruit of your loom!
reviews.title: Disney, universal and orlando trip with family from Dr John

reviews.text: As a Starwood member I usually take advantage of perks, promo's and membership advantage that Sheraton offers to me for both domestic and international travel.
reviews.title: Love the pool

reviews.text: This journey/vacation was with my 6 year old daughter and lovely wife. We stayed at the property for 8 days.
reviews.title: A nice place for the last night of our Florida vacation

reviews.text: NOW THE REVIEW:
reviews.title: A very nice stay, but could be better

reviews.text: Disgraceful. This motel should be branded under the Four Points name so Starwood customers know that this is a lower end Starwood motel. Shower has no water pressure. You have to flush the toilet multiple times. Elevators to rooms seem unsafe and will close on you. We got a suite but the room was very narrow and the bathroom was tiny. The motel was not cheap on a per night basis either. For the money (or for just a few more dollars a night which would be worth it) you could stay at a much much much nicer hotel. Looks like Starwood bought this old, dingy motel property, fixed up the lobby, slapped a coat of paint in the halls, did nothing to the rooms and now calls it a resort...and charges a resort fee??? Staff was nice though. Come on Starwood. You can do better.
reviews.title: Many better options to choose from

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed here for 9 nights. The moment we pulled up, I was very impressed with the valet staff. They were quick with our bags, and very knowlegable about the area, hotel, DW, and US. Once we walked in the lobby, I loved how bright and airy it was. The front desk agent was very nice and check in was rather quick. The pool area is very nice with lots of lounge chairs, a nice bar, cool fire pit area, and water slide! However, the rooms, that is another story. You can instantly tell once you get off the very slow elevator that this hotel is a work in progress. The rooms are ok. The bathroom area has a very weird set up, with the light switch being on the outside of the bathroom door. The vanity area was recently updated and nice with plugs on both sides. The bed was very comfy but I wasn't a fan of the "down pillows" but hey that's me. I don't like squishy pillows. Our room was a street facing room and did have a little balcony, which was nice for fresh air. Overall, our experience was nice until our last day. We decided our last full day to take advantage of the pool. We ordered lunch from "Joe" at the bar and he seemed very annoyed to take our order. I had to confirm with him which 2 sides I wanted with my burger and he never asked how we wanted it cooked. My boyfriend and I assumed they cook all of the burgers to the same temp so we took our place at our lounge chairs. About 15 min later, he came over to tell us our burgers were 3 after the ones currently on the grill because "the burgers are frozen" ok...TMI...we didn't need to know the burgers were frozen. The food here ok, nothing special, but does hit the spot. The bar staff seemed irritated by everyone, and the drinks were rather weak for their price. We did eat in the restaurant one time and our server was very sweet! Oksana? I can't remember her name but it was an Eastern European name. She was very attentive and made sure we were happy! Kudos to her! For the future, we have decided to stay on a Disney property because we spent a lot of money on cabs to go to/from Disney World due to the limited (and very full) shuttle to Disney World, and no transportation to Universal Studios.
reviews.title: A work in progress...

reviews.text: Not a 4 star resort, have a resort fee why because they have a pool. I would consider this more of a motel than a hotel. AC in the room was so loud!!!!! Overall not impressed. Elevators old and smelly. I have stayed at plenty of 4 star hotels and I dont know how this one got a 4 star rating.
reviews.title: Not a 4 star resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped over in Orlando for a few nights following our holiday in Montego Bay and as we are regulars of Starwood (SPG Platinum) we decided to stay in this Sheraton.
reviews.title: Not our best Starwood Stay

reviews.text: The trip didn't start out great as the room we had been given was overlooking the front of the building and there was a very large smear stain all down the widow (like a bucket of old watery paint had been splashed down it). When we complained we were moved to another room that had a pool view which was better but on two separate occasions we had to call out the maintenance man to let us into the room as the room lock was playing up.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: My family recently stayed at this hotel for a week long vacation. We stayed in a king junior suite in building 4. Our SPG Gold status earned us an upgrade, which was a nice surprise. We had no expectations, as we know it is all based on our status and availability. Apparently our timing was great. Our status also got us 2 bottles of water a day, and the ability to waive the resort/parking/internet fee.
reviews.title: Would stay again, staff does a good job, pool is great!

reviews.text: All rooms in building 4 have an outside entry, and over look the pool. The pool area is great. In fact it is as good as larger pool areas at more upscale hotels that cost more such as The Peabody, and Hilton Bonnet Creek. If you want a fun pool area, and are on a budget, this is a great option. It is not a huge spacious resort like the ones just mentioned. It is a small, renovated property, which is not a bad thing. To get from the parking lot to our room took all but 2 minutes at the most. This made it easy on us at the end of the day. Especially when we had a handful of bags, take out, or had to carry our kids up to the room.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: Our family of four found the room spacious, comfortable, and clean. Housekeeping was fantastic, and timely. The bed was fantastic. The pull out couch was clean and well maintained. We used it every night, and housekeeping changed the sheets when requested.
reviews.title: Summer Holiday Orlando

reviews.text: We ate in the hotel twice. Once we had lunch at the pool, and the food was average at best. For our second meal, we took our kids to see the magic show in the hotel called The Man of Mystery. It was an all you can eat buffet style meal. Fried chicken, meatloaf, mashed potatoes, gravy, vegetables, salad, and dessert. It was fantastic. We loved the meal.The show was $25 per adult, $10 per child. Some hotel guests balked at the price and what was being served when they entered the dining room. That just made it better for us. The magic show had only about 12 people, and it was great. Kids enjoyed it. The performer spend a lot of time with the group, and was a very nice guy. He works the breakfast buffet as well doing tricks, and making balloons.
reviews.title: Great Escape from the Chaos

reviews.text: We had a couple of issues during our stay, but they were swiftly handled by management with ease. The staff aims to please. Lisa B., Gil R., Elizabeth M., Dercy, and Eric are all worth mentioning as they provided excellent service.
reviews.title: While Not a Luxury resort - very good value for money while in Orlando

reviews.text: I generally stay at 4 and 5 star hotels, but upon learning that this hotel was just renovated, and due to it's very close proximity to disney - and as I could book using SPG points - I gave it a try, and, overall, I'm glad that I did.
reviews.title: good stay

reviews.text: Only stayed one night, not impressed but not the worst of hotels either. Not in the best area but a pretty convenient location to all of the theme parks. The room was average at best, pretty clean, carpet was old and dingy looking. The bed was comfortable for the most part. Rip off resort fee, if this felt like a resort then don't mind the fee. I would not stay here again and since this is my first stay at a Sheraton I don't think I will be staying at any in the future.
reviews.title: Low grade resort

reviews.text: Stayed here over spring break with three kids. Great renovations, rooms were clean and beds comfortable. Very nice pool area, although very crowded.Very close to Downtown Disney. Only real complaint was gift/snack shop. No prices on any food items, understaffed (always a big line in the morning for coffee}, and not much selection. If you can get a good rate here, it is a good option when traveling with kids.
reviews.title: Great for Families

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2-nights. This is a renovated property but it is very up to date, beautiful and clean!! The Staff from Valet, Check-in, pool staff and Spa were all beyond friendly, helpful and made us feel comfortable and relaxed.
reviews.title: Great Stay & Incredible Staff!!

reviews.text: We had a few spa treatments and the Spa was absolutely wonderful! My husband said he had the best massage ever!! I had a facial and a 25-minute massage which were both out of the world excellent. I liked that the Esthetician was educational about skin care not only for me, but also made suggestions for my husband!
reviews.title: Great experience-great deal!

reviews.text: The Hotel is very close to lots of restaurants and even a 24-hour grocery store if needed!
reviews.title: Disappointing, would not return

description: Create unforgettable memories as you enjoy the city. Complimentary transportation to all Walt Disney World parks or relax with the family in one of our 489 guest rooms.
